headline: ETF Edge: How investors are handling geopolitical uncertainty and energy pricing whiplash
summary: Energy markets around the world have been shaken up by geopolitical volatility, most notably in Venezuela and Iran. However, there’s much more to the story beyond just those two countries. VanEck CEO Jan Van Eck and TCW global head of distribution Jennifer Grancio join CNBC’s Dominic Chu on “ETF Edge” to discuss the changing landscape, “new” energy vs. “old” energy, and what the next big opportunities are for investors in the energy space.

headline: New revolutionaries in power evolution offer ‘huge opportunity’ right now, says TCW’s Jennifer Grancio
summary: As the face of the energy landscape changes, TCW global head of distribution Jennifer Grancio sits down with CNBC’s Dominic Chu on “ETF Edge” to discuss what her firm is looking for on the new energy front. Grancio says she is looking for winners in the field, and companies that are the best at what they do, as data centers aim to become more efficient. VanEck CEO Jan Van Eck joins the conversation.

headline: Vistra Announces Private Offering of Senior Secured Notes
summary: Vistra Corp. (NYSE: VST) (the "Company" or "Vistra") announced today the launch of senior secured notes due 2031 and senior secured notes due 2036 (collectively, the "Notes") in a private offering (the "Offering") to qualified institutional buyers pursuant to Rule 144A under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the "Securities Act"), and to certain non-U.S. persons in accordance with Regulation S under the Securities Act. headline: Heard on the Street Friday Recap: Record Highs Again
summary: The unemployment rate ticked down to 4.4%.  The report capped a weak year for hiring and cleared the way for the Federal Reserve to hold rates steady at its late-January meeting.  The White House confirmed that President Trump posted job-market statistics online Thursday that were supposed to remain confidential until the next day.
